clinical_study.brief_title: Benefits of Relaxation by Music Therapy on PTSD Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: Exploration of Cerebral Metabolism and Connectivity in Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD): Exploratory Study of Neurofunctional Modulation of Emotions by Music Therapy

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut de Recherche Biomedicale des Armees

clinical_study.source: Institut de Recherche Biomedicale des Armees

brief_summary.textblock:
PTSD is a debilitating mental disorder that may develop after experiencing or witnessing a life-threatening event. With appropriate care, treatment efficiency is variable and around 20% of the patients do not respond to psychological treatment. Complementary treatments are needed.
as PTSD implied autonomic nervous system (ANS) dysfonction, complementary treatment focusing on ANS regulation, as welle as musicotherapy, may have an interest.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim is to evaluate the impact of musicotherapy on PTSD symptoms, and severity using a RCT Symptoms will be evaluated using questionaires (PCL and quality of life) severity will be measured using neurological soft signs assessment, connectomic functions and ANS regulation

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from PTSD symptoms at two months and at six months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from neurological soft signs at two months and at six months
secondary_outcome.description: questionnaire EPSID " Psychomotor assessment scale of neurological soft signs no threshold

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from effective connectomic at two months and at six months
change from Autonomous nervous system regulation at two months and at six months
secondary_outcome.description: heart rate variability during 5 min at rest

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from biological stress at two months and at six months

arm_group.description: daily sessions of music listening during 2 months, associated with their standard treatment,

intervention.description: receptive music therapy. The musical style of the session was chosen by the patient. The validated 'U' technique was employed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- PTSD
Exclusion Criteria:
- neurological diseases
- addiction
